_prev_prog_2.MD_OtherType: Presently daily check for leaks by smell.
_prev_prog_2.CH_OtherChanges: Have installed automatic breakaways on loadouts
_prev_prog_2.CT_OtherType: review written emergency plan, and attend safety training by I.D.O.A.

_prev_prog_2.Description: Compliance with Anhydrous Ammonis Rules and Standards. Regular Inspsections and Maintenance to Maintain Mechanical Intergrity. Operator training for all employees. Daily Equipment Inspections in Season, Annual review fo Safety Information and Operational Procedures.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: Illinois Department of Agriculture Anhydrous Ammonia Regulations

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Excutive Summary
   1. The Facility Policy  
         A. To maintain equipment in optimum condition to assure safety for employees, area residents, and surrounding   
               environment.
        B.  All personnel will be well trained in procedures for handling product safely.
        C.  Safety equipment, and contact people and agencies available and posted at all times.
   2. Facility Information
        Facility Known as: Belpark Ltd.  Custom Farm Service
        Located at:            RR 1,  Box 15 ,  Shobonier, IL. 62885
                                   ( 1 mile north of Shobonier, 1/8 mile west of U.S. Rt. 51)
                                                              Facility Phone (618) 846 2201
                                                  Owner/Manager Phone (618) 425 3476
   3. Worst-Case Release Scenario
               Notify Manager, Fire Department, and all people in the 1.16 mile vicinty in the event of a major release of product.
               Implement contaiment with water mists from nearby reservoirs, if proper equipment is used and conditions are safe 
               to do so.
         (Note: facility is in a predominately rural area. Distance to the nearest residence 1000'. There are 4 homes in 1/4 mile
               of the facility. There are trees and buildings surrounding the facility that will significantly alter drift from as accidental
               release.)
   4. Accidental release Program for this facility.
                Yes, written accident release program and employees trained for response.
   5. The Five-Year Accident History
                There have been no accidents at this facility.
   6. The Emergency Response Program
                1. Notification of Fire Department, Emergency Disaster Agency, Manager and all individuals who may lay in 
                    the path of the released product.
                2. Review safety procedures and

containment proceedures before attempting containment.
   7. Planned changes to improve safety
                1. Improve and enhance Safety training for employees.
                2. Present Safety information to area response agencies to better advise them.
